metadata.title: Kalai Ruti। কলাই রুটি । Bengali Recipe | Rural Recipes
metadata.description:
Kalai Ruti by Masuda Bibi of Gorbhanga I রুরাল রেসিপির ষষ্ঠ পর্ব । নদীয়ার গোরভাঙার বাসিন্দা মাসুদা বিবির হাতের রান্না :  কলাই রুটি ।

Rural local recipes are integral part of Intangible Cultural Heritage and needs to be preserved and promoted. We at banglanatak dot com have been working for the past 22+ years to safeguard and promote local cultural heritages in rural spaces across India.

transcription_bengali: [00:00:19] আজ আমি এসেছি নদিয়া জেলার করিমপুরের গোরভাঙা গ্রামে—একটা বিশেষ জায়গায়।
[00:00:25] ডাটাবাবা লালন আশ্রমে চলছে বাউল-ফকিরি উৎসব।
[00:00:30] বাউল গানের ভক্ত আর কথক হিসেবে আমি আগেও বহুবার এখানে এসেছি।
[00:00:35] আরমান ফকিরির হাতের নানা ছোট ছোট পদও খেয়েছি।
[00:00:40] তিন দিন ধরে বাউল গান শুনব, আর আপনাদের সামনে কিছু নতুন রেসিপি নিয়ে আসব।
[00:00:51] চেষ্টা করব রান্নার রেসিপির সঙ্গে সঙ্গে উৎসবটাও আপনাদের দেখাতে।
[00:00:59] সারাদিন বাউল গান চলবে, আর সন্ধ্যায় এই মঞ্চে আসর বসবে।
[00:01:13] এটা গোরভাঙা গ্রামের ডাটাবাবা লালন আশ্রম—আরমান ফকিরির বাড়ি।
[00:01:51] বাউল গান শুনতে চাইলে বছরের যে কোনো সময় এখানেই আসতে পারেন।
[00:01:59] বাবু, এই সঙ্গীত উৎসবটা সম্পর্কে একটু বলুন।
[00:02:02] আমি নদিয়ার ডিএম-এর সঙ্গে কাজ করেছি।
[00:02:09] উনি আমাকে একটা হোমস্টের ব্যবস্থা করে দিয়েছিলেন।
[00:02:13] বাইরের লোকেরাও এখানে থেকে যেতে পারেন।
[00:02:27] চলুন, এখন আমার ভাসুরবউ/বউদির কাছে যাই।
[00:02:37] এত বছর ধরে এখানে আসছি, কিন্তু বউদির কথা কখনও শুনিনি।
[00:03:12] এই রুটিটা হয় গমের আটা, কলাই (উড়দ) ডাল আর চালের গুঁড়ো/আটা দিয়ে।
[00:03:18] মাটির হাঁড়ি/চুলো যদি গরম না থাকে তাহলে কী করবেন?
[00:03:22] মাটিটা গরম থাকতে হবে আর শুকনো থাকতে হবে।
[00:04:11] হাতে বানানো রুটির সঙ্গে এই লঙ্কার ঝাল খাওয়া হয়।
[00:04:14] লঙ্কা, পেঁয়াজ, লেবু, নুন আর তেল—সব মিশিয়ে বানানো হয়।
[00:05:01] যারা ভাত খেতে ভালোবাসেন, তাদের জন্য এটা স্পেশাল পদ।
[00:05:06] আর যারা ভাত খান না—তাদের কাছে আমি দুঃখিত।
[00:05:11] গোরভাঙা গ্রামে যখনই আসি, বউদিকে বলি হাতে রুটি বানাতে,
[00:06:07] আমি আপনাদের দেখাতে চাই—রুটিটা কীভাবে বানানো হয়।
[00:06:25] দেখুন, রুটিটা কত সুন্দর গোল হয়েছে।
[00:06:52] নলেন গুড়ের একটা ভরা চামচ দিল।
[00:07:17] খুব সিম্পল খাবার, কিন্তু স্বাদ দারুণ।
[00:07:24] এ ধরনের খাবার খেতে চাইলে গোরভাঙায় আসতেই হবে।
[00:07:30] হাতে রুটি, লঙ্কার ঝাল—আর (সঙ্গে) যা খেতে ভালো লাগে।
transcription_english: [00:00:19] Today I’ve come to a special place in Nadia district—Gorbhanga village, Karimpur.
[00:00:25] A Baul-Fakiri festival is going on at Datababa Lalon Ashram.
[00:00:30] As a Baul music devotee and storyteller, I have come here many times before.
[00:00:35] I’ve also eaten many small dishes made by Arman Fakiri.
[00:00:40] I will listen to Baul music for three days and bring some new recipes to you.
[00:00:48] This is the stage.
[00:00:51] I’ll try to show you the festival along with cooking recipes.
[00:00:59] Baul music will go on all day, and the main program on this stage will be held in the evening.
[00:01:13] This is Datababa Lalon Ashram in Gorbhanga village—the home of Arman Fakiri.
[00:01:18] This is Babu Fakiri.
[00:01:22] Jai Guru, Jai Guru, Jai Guru.
[00:01:26] How many artists will come for the Baul-Fakiri festival?
[00:01:33] Around 600 artists will come.
[00:01:37] There will be many artists.
[00:01:39] From Nadia, Murshidabad, Birbhum, Bankura, and other places.
[00:01:45] We wanted to bring good artists.
[00:01:51] If you want to come and listen to Baul music, you can come here any time of the year.
[00:01:59] Babu, please tell us about this music festival.
[00:02:02] I have worked with the District Magistrate (DM) of Nadia.
[00:02:09] He helped arrange a homestay for me.
[00:02:11] This is a music festival.
[00:02:13] People from outside can stay here.
[00:02:16] We have 8–10 houses here.
[00:02:20] It’s a very beautiful place.
[00:02:21] I have been staying here since yesterday.
[00:02:27] Let’s go to my sister-in-law (boudi).
[00:02:37] I’ve been coming here for so many years, but I had never heard about this boudi before.
[00:02:42] She was married at the age of 11.
[00:02:47] Everyone calls her “boudi.”
[00:02:50] She has even forgotten her father’s name.
[00:02:54] Her name is Masuda Bibi (the meaning is mentioned as “dry”).
[00:03:08] For snacks, there is handmade roti.
[00:03:12] This roti is made with wheat flour, kalai/urad flour, and rice flour.
[00:03:18] What do you do if the clay stove/pan isn’t hot?
[00:03:22] The clay has to be hot and dry.
[00:03:26] Can this roti be made on a gas stove?
[00:03:28] This roti cannot be made on gas.
[00:03:46] (Cooking) The roti is being roasted on the clay pan.
[00:03:51] The first roti is ready.
[00:03:55] I can’t wait any longer.
[00:03:57] I’ll start eating now.
[00:04:00] Akash is with me.
[00:04:03] Sister-in-law’s handmade roti,
[00:04:06] and a special green chili mash/pickle.
[00:04:08] How is the chili mix made?
[00:04:10] Give it to Akash.
[00:04:11] This chili mix is eaten with the handmade roti.
[00:04:14] Chili, onion, lemon, salt, and oil are mixed together.
[00:04:22] It tastes really good.
[00:04:24] Mustard oil, right?
[00:04:24] Yes, mustard oil.
[00:04:25] What else is there?
[00:04:27] Onion, salt, and oil.
[00:04:32] Mustard oil.
[00:04:34] Mix it well.
[00:04:34] Mix it well.
[00:04:35] Now you mix it.
[00:04:48] This is a very spicy item.
[00:04:58] It’s very spicy.
[00:05:01] For those who love to eat rice, this is a special dish.
[00:05:06] And for those who don’t eat rice, I’m very sorry!
[00:05:09] But this is one of my favorite foods.
[00:05:11] Whenever I come to Gorbhanga village, I request boudi to make this handmade roti,
[00:05:19] and this chili mix/pickle.
[00:05:31] It is very spicy.
[00:05:33] Very spicy.
[00:05:37] Thank you, boudi.
[00:05:49] Very spicy.
[00:05:51] Yes, very spicy.
[00:06:07] I want to show you how this roti is made.
[00:06:11] It is quite thick,
[00:06:14] and slightly flattened.
[00:06:19] The roti is roasted on a clay pan/pot.
[00:06:23] It is made completely by hand.
[00:06:25] You can see the roti is beautiful and round.
[00:06:32] This is Nolen Gur (date palm jaggery).
[00:06:43] For those who don’t like spicy food,
[00:06:46] there is another option—
[00:06:47] with jaggery.
[00:06:49] Akash gave me
[00:06:52] a heaped spoon of Nolen Gur.
[00:06:54] It tastes wonderful,
[00:06:56] especially in winter,
[00:06:57] when fresh jaggery arrives.
[00:06:59] This jaggery is really good.
[00:07:17] This is a very simple food, but it tastes excellent.
[00:07:24] If you want to eat food like this, you have to come to Gorbhanga.
[00:07:29] Or you can make it at home.
[00:07:30] Handmade roti with chili mix—and anything else you like to eat it with.
